data.title: Archive news from the The Argus
data.meta_description: Archive news from the The Argus
data.text:
Hughton named LMA Championship manager of the year

Albion boss Chris Hughton has been named the LMA Sky Bet Championship Manager of the Year. It may seem little consolation on a heart-breaking night for the Seagulls when their promotion dream ended in the semi-finals of the play-offs for the third

Hughton hits out as key decision scuppers Albion's promotion dream

Albion boss Chris Hughton has blamed another key decision for blunting his team’s bid to stage a comeback in the play-offs against Sheffield Wednesday. Goalscorer Lewis Dunk appeared to be pushed by Gary Hooper when Ross Wallace’s cross pulled

Bloom thanks Albion's players on emotional post-match changing room visit

Tony Bloom has thanked Albion’s players for their efforts this season. The Albion chairman visited the squad in their changing room shortly after tonight’s 1-1 draw with Sheffield Wednesday. Vastly experienced midfielder Steve Sidwell said:

Proud Albion's dream is over - but they gave it a real go

Albion’s promotion dream is over – but they gave a it a real go at the Amex tonight. The Seagulls drew 1-1 at home to Sheffield Wednesday to suffer a 3-1 play-off semi-final defeat on aggregate. It is their third semi-final exit in the last

Albion 1 Sheffield Wednesday 1 (1-3 on aggregate): How we reported the drama from the Amex....

9:56pm Wednesday are still out there celebrating their semi-final success. Thanks for following.

Eight weeks in jail for man who touched women indecently

A Bexhill man has gone to prison for eight weeks for sexually assaulting a 16-year old girl and a 36-year old woman in the town. Sanjay Mahalingam, 27, of Wickham Avenue, Bexhill, who works at a fast food restaurant in Ninfield Road, was charged

Knockaert and Sidwell passed fit for Albion - but there's no Hemed

Albion have been handed a double boost for their semi-final second leg. Both Steve Sidwell and Anthony Knockaert have been passed fit to start against Sheffield Wednesday tonight. The pair were two of four men who left the first meeting at

Sussex have plenty to do after seamers take control

Worcestershire turned up the heat on Sussex as the seamers took control on the second day of the Specsavers County Championship clash at New Road. After four sessions dominated by batsmen as Worcestershire made 491, the visitors came under severe

Family of 'road rage' stabbing victim slam NHS trust over killer's treatment

The family of a retired solicitor stabbed to death by a mentally ill man following a minor shunt have blasted the NHS for failings that left him free to kill. Matthew Daley, 35, knifed 79-year-old Donald Lock 39 times after their cars crashed on

NHS trust to review 10 killings involving patients following Donald Lock case

An NHS trust will review 10 killings involving its patients after admitting it "got things wrong" with the treatment of a mentally ill man who stabbed a retired solicitor to death. Matthew Daley, 35, was found guilty of manslaughter on the grounds

Police warning as phone fraudsters target elderly

A spate of phone fraud has led police to fear that sophisticated scammers are targeting vulnerable victims. An 88-year-old Brighton man and his 54-year-old daughter of West Hill Place were called by a man with a foreign accent on May 6, who said

Matthew Daley was 'ideal' child before mental health decline, says mother

Matthew Daley was an "ideal" child before the breakdown of his parents' marriage while he was at university coincided with his mental health decline. His mother, Lynda Daley, said for 10 years they had appealed for him to receive better care and

Family man who lived life to full and was 'not your typical great-grandfather'

Described as a "kind, gentle and fair man", Donald Lock was by all accounts a loving and much-loved family man who lived life to the full. The 79-year-old retired solicitor had recently celebrated 55 years of marriage to his wife Maureen with whom

Matthew Daley found guilty of the manslaughter grandfather Don Lock

MATTHEW Daley has been found guilty of manslaughter of great grandfather Don Lock. He stabbed the 79-year-old 39 times on the side of the road after a shunt between their cars on July 16 last year. The 35-year-old denied murder claiming diminished

Wanted woman rearrested after breaching bail

Karina Burnett, who was wanted on recall to prison, has been arrested. Burnett, 29, breached the terms of her license after being jailed for robbery. She was arrested by officers in Battle and been returned to prison

Couple robbed by masked gang after late-night knock on door.

A couple who responded to a late-night knock at their front door were robbed by a gang of masked men. At about 11.30pm on Saturday 7 May there was a knock at the door at an address in The Bourne, Hastings. When the 48-year old woman opened

Taylor taking a break from cricket

Sussex captain and England women's wicketkeeper Sarah Taylor is to take a break from cricket, and may miss this summer's series at home to Pakistan. Taylor's decision, confirmed only days after England's long-serving captain Charlotte Edwards announced

Vickers back at Lewes

LEWES have added to their list of summer signings by bringing former Albion youth team skipper Tom Vickers back to the club. Vickers, who has also played for Hastings and Horsham, played eight times for the Rooks during the 2013-14 campaign.

Engineering work cancelled to allow fans to get to and from Falmer

PLANNED engineering work which would have severely impacted on travel to Falmer station has been moved. Brighton and Hove Albion fans had been warned to expect delays and cancellations on trains to and from the main station which serves Falmer.

Two men sent to prison after drugs worth a potential £1 million and live bullets seized in police operation

TWO men have been sent to prison after drugs with a potential street value of £1 million and live bullets were seized. Jed Ballard (pictured left) and Pavel Ryslink (right) were both given custodial sentences when they appeared at Brighton Crown

Five great Albion comebacks

1991 Ipswich Barry Lloyd's Albion were unravelling in their bid for promotion and looked set to miss out on the play-offs in the last game of the season at the Goldstone. Two wins in nine matches left them needing to beat Ipswich to sneak into

Heroes and villains join in run for charity

SUPER Mario, the Joker and Jeremy Hunt were among the heroes and villains taking part in a battle of good versus evil on Hove seafront. The runner dressed as the Health Secretary was one of the most unusual costumes in the annual event. Organiser

REVIEW: Casual Violence, The Warren, Brighton Fringe - ★★★★★

The Warren’s a cheerful place this year, with papier-mâché animals resting beneath twinkling fairy lights, and the sound of laughter and excitement ringing in the air. The Brighton Fringe has enjoyed glorious weather during the first half of May

REVIEW: Aphrodite in Flippers, The Warren, Brighton Fringe - ★★★

"A good set of stays is what a young woman needs these days." This was a delightfully wacky show that attracted a large crowd for an afternoon performance. Everybody loves a party and it was Georgie's 40th. The three female caste members

REVIEW: The Comeback Special, Brighton Dome Corn Exchange, Brighton Festival - ★★★★

On paper this might have looked an odd proposition: a one man show about a TV performance from Elvis, in the form of detailed commentary rather than a performance per se - in fact a ‘tell’ rather than ‘show’. But as a piece of theatre it (mainly

REVIEW: Bat for Lashes, St George's Church, Brighton - ★★★★

‘Welcome to my wedding’ grins Natasha Khan – aka Bat for Lashes – after walking alone down the aisle of St. George’s Church in her hometown. ‘You all look wonderful.’ Many fans have acted upon Khan’s request to get into the spirit of her new album

REVIEW: Release Your Inner Cartoonist, Sallis Benney Theatre, Brighton Festival - ★★★★

Brighton's own Harry Venning has been a renowned cartoonist for years, including his Clare In The Community strip in The Guardian and Hamlet, the perennially out of work thespian pig, in The Stage. Each audience member was presented with paper

REVIEW: Police Cops, Sweet Waterfront, Brighton Fringe - ★★★★★

1980s police cops dramas - the all American Dream encapsulated by macho officers, over the top drama and remarkably efficient crime solving. It's an easy subject for a satirical comedy. But The Pretend Men trio take it to a whole new level.

REVIEW: Tales of Mystery and Imagination, Preston Church, Brighton Fringe - ★★★

Writer Edgar Allan Poe is famous for his horror writing. So the medieval Preston Church seemed like the perfect location for an evening exploring some of his macabre works. Richard Spaul from the In Situ theatre company enthusiastically took on

REVIEW: Name Dropping, The Old Courtroom, Brighton Fringe - ★★★

He's a household name in Latvia and he almost went on a date with Liza Minnelli. Meet David Benedictus, novelist, screenwriter, poet, theatre director, columnist, horse racing tipster. The Hollywood actress Carol Seymour once squeezed his bottom

REVIEW: A Cottage on Dartmoor, Brighton Buddhist Centre, Brighton Fringe - ★★★

This was a tale of mental illness, mandalas and hard wooden chairs. Filmspot 'create temporary pop-up cinemas in unusual and heritage venues ... to bring films to life and turn a night out at the pictures back into an event.' On this occasion

Hughton tells Albion fans to pump up the volume

ALBION boss Chris Hughton has called on the Amex faithful to roar his depleted team to Wembley. He has urged the crowd to pump up the volume this evening against Sheffield Wednesday. Hull or Derby await the winners in the Championship play-off

Three people rescued by fire crews as shed is completely destroyed in blaze

THREE people had to be rescued by fire crews after a shed was destroyed in a blaze. Fire crews went to High Street in Selsey just after 6.40am this morning and found the 15m shed, used as a paper store, well alight. The three occupants of an

Motorcyclist dies in road crash with white Fiesta - man arrested

A MAN has been arrested after a motorcyclist died in a road crash. The rider of a green Kawasaki – a 22-year-old local man – sustained fatal injuries following the accident on the B2096 Kane Hythe Road in Battle at about 6pm on Saturday. He

Albion fans face travel chaos as Southern warns of cancellations

ALBION fans have been warned they could face severe rail disruption as they head for tonight’s game-of-the-season. Southern Rail have advised Brighton and Hove Albion FC to expect cancellations on services to Falmer, with fans told to arrive early

Sainsbury’s is leading the way with its environmental policies

THIS week Sainsbury's has announced it plans to install combined heat and power (CHP) units in six more of its stores across the UK, bringing the national total up to 16. It is not yet known if any of these are in Sussex, but the strategy is one

Retirement may not be that far away, Mr Corbyn

WHEN the sun shines, there's no better place to be than the south coast.With dozens of bustling seafront towns and villages nesting within the rolling Downs, it's no wonder that thousands chose to retreat to Sussex to put their feet up.While towns

Please, no rail chaos

Tonight two issues of huge importance to our readers collide.Brighton and Hove Albion FC go into the second-leg of their play-off looking to overcome a two-nil deficit against promotion rivals Sheffield Wednesday.It is not thought any team has emerged

Crash between lorry and car causes tailbacks through Lewes

A LORRY and a car crashed at a tunnel entrance earlier this morning. The accident happened at 7.20am near the Cuilfail Tunnel and Malling Street (the A26) in Lewes. Traffic reports suggest it is near the Caffyns Garage and the snail sculpture

We can do this - Zamora's video message to Albion fans

Albion star - and twice play-off final hero - Bobby Zamora has urged fans to believe in a dramatic comeback at the Amex tonight. Zamora expects Seagulls supporters to get right behind their side at the semi-final second leg against Sheffield Wednesday

Hundreds take part in Equality Walk for Stonewall

HUNDREDS of people joined forces for the annual Equality Walk organised by the charity Stonewall.The event took place earlier this week with supporters following a route in the centre of Brighton and along the seafront.Entertainment was also provided

Tonight's the time for fringe men to become Albion's new heroes

ALBION’S fringe men can become club heroes against Sheffield Wednesday. That is the message from manager Chris Hughton to the players unexpectedly back in contention in his injury-ravaged squad for tonight’s second leg of the play-offs against

Children with high attendance rates should be allowed on term time holidays says council chief

A FATHER who is fighting a blanket ban on taking children out of school during terms times has been backed by a leading city councillor. Noah Myers has been fined twice by Brighton and Hove City Council and now plans to take his case to the European

Thief who stole ancient church relics after brainwave at Brighton car boot sale behind bars

A SERIAL thief who concocted a nationwide plan to steal ancient church relics after visiting a Brighton car boot sale is behind bars. Amateur antiques dealer Christopher Cooper has been sent to prison for three years and eight months after stealing

All herald the new era of the drag king

EVERYONE has heard of the dress wearing, lipstick sporting and bewigged drag queens, but meet the bearded, chest hair flaunting drag kings. The King of the Fringe contest saw a host of women performing as men and competing for the coveted crown

Join record breaking paddle boarding attempt

AN ACTIVITY holiday company is inviting people to have a go at breaking the Guinness World Record for the largest parade of paddle boarders. Neilson, based in Brighton is calling on anyone who is game to join in with a unique event where 300 boarders

Growing fears over the state of over conditions at Lewes Prison

AN MP has asked for a meeting with the prisons minister to raise concerns about conditions inside Lewes Prison. Understaffing at the Category B men’s prison means it is struggling to cope with a spike in violence and prisoners have missed medical

Family launch support fund in son's memory

A FUND has been set up to support families coping with tragedy following the death of a man at a level crossing. Tommy Ramshaw was killed after being hit by a train where a track crosses Brunswick Road in Shoreham. Following the 20-year-old's

Albion can make history tonight with big win against Sheffield Wednesday

ALBION have the chance to make footballing history tonight with fans insisting a comeback triumph is within the Seagulls’ grasp.The toughest assignment in play-off history lies before them, as Hughton’s men look to overturn a 2-0 deficit incurred against

Voluntary and community groups celebrate success at Spark Awards 2016

THE achievements of voluntary and community groups working with young people have been recognised at a glittering ceremony.The Spark Awards celebrate not only the inspiring children and young people belonging to the groups, but also the dedicated staff

Free swimming for under 16s in Brighton and Hove to continue

THOUSANDS of children and teenagers will be able to enjoy free swimming for another year.Brighton and Hove City Council is one of only a handful of local authorities in the country to keep the scheme going since the Government stopped its funding in 2010

A glimpse behind the world of David Bowie at never-before-seen photographic exhibition

THE death of David Bowie in January shocked the world of music.While his legacy of live performances and graceful albums remains familiar to many, another side of the frontman is to be seen in Brighton and Hove for the first time.A UK exhibition tour
